snippet: The Port of Seattle’s board meeting brought three hours of heated testimony and attempts to delay mooring Shell’s rigs at the port in preparation for Arctic drilling.
abstract: Port of Seattle's board votes to ask Foss Maritime to delay hosting of Shell's arctic drilling rigs, spurred by public pressure over company plans to use Puget Sound as home port for summer drilling operation in Alaska; vote does not rescind lease signed allowing Shell to use space, nor does it compel any delay; reflects debate that in many ways is proxy fight over Shell's drilling and, by extension, climate change.
lead_paragraph: The Port of Seattle’s board meeting brought three hours of heated testimony and attempts to delay mooring Shell’s rigs at the port in preparation for Arctic drilling.

headline.main: Seattle Port Votes to Delay Drilling Rigs on the Way to Alaska
headline.print_headline: Drilling Stirs Passions on the Way to Alaska
